item.title: Building with AI
item.description: AI features are only useful when they actually ship. Keep the scaffolding light, prefer smaller feedback loops, and bias toward automation that is observable.

item.title: Data Onboarding Checklist
item.description: Before wiring a new feed into production, walk through this short list:

item.title: UI Polish in 30 Minutes
item.description:
Run this sprint-friendly checklist when an interface feels off:

  • Tighten spacing by standardizing padding tokens and removing stray margins.
  • Anchor text styles to two headline sizes and one body size to avoid randomness.
  • Add subtle focus states so keyboard flows remain visible.
  • Swap blurry assets for SVGs or WebP exports to reduce layout shift.

Small touches compound; ship the pass and iterate rather than wait for perfect mocks.

item.title: Shipping Faster with Feature Flags
item.description: Feature flags shine when they are boring: every experiment gets a name, an owner, and a removal plan. Keep the code path slim so toggling off is instant.

item.title: Writing Markdown that Ages Well
item.description: Prefer short files, descriptive headings, and local examples. Future you will thank you for removing jokes and adding a Last updated note when facts change.

item.title: Keeping Hugo Content Organized
item.description: Use section folders to scope list templates, and keep shared taxonomies lean. When adding a new content type, start with a dedicated _index.md that documents how to contribute.
